About PesoScan

A Computer Vision-Based Counterfeit Detection, Denomination Classification, and Damage Assessment System for Philippine Banknotes and Coins Using Convolutional Neural Networks and YOLOv8

What is PesoScan?

This study develops an intelligent computer vision system that detects counterfeit Philippine banknotes and coins, identifies denominations, and assesses their damage/condition using YOLOv8 and Custom Convolutional Neural Networks (CNN). It enables accurate authentication with reporting to the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP), enhancing financial security through a fast and reliable deep learningbased solution.

How It Works

1

Image Capture/Upload

Users capture a photo using their device camera or upload an existing image of a peso banknote.

2

Object Detection

YOLOv8 model detects and localizes the peso banknote within the image frame for precise analysis.

3

Feature Analysis

CNN classifier analyzes security features including watermarks, security threads, and microprinting.

4

Result Generation

System provides authenticity classification with confidence score and detailed analysis.

Technology Stack

Frontend

  • ReactJS
  • CSS3 with custom design system
  • WebRTC for camera access
  • Axios for API communication

Backend

  • Python FastAPI
  • OpenCV for image processing
  • RESTful API architecture
  • Swagger documentation

Machine Learning

  • YOLOv8 (Ultralytics)
  • Custom CNN model
  • TensorFlow/PyTorch
  • Computer vision algorithms

Key Features

Real-time Camera Scanning

Live capture and analysis using device camera with instant feedback.

Advanced Detection

State-of-the-art object detection and classification algorithms.

Confidence Scoring

Detailed confidence percentages for transparency and reliability.

Security Feature Analysis

Detailed examination of watermarks, threads, and other security elements.

Responsive Design

Works seamlessly across desktop, tablet, and mobile devices.

Scan History

Track and manage previous scans with detailed records and statistics.

Development Team

PesoScan is developed by Computer Science students from the Technological Institute of the Philippines, combining expertise in artificial intelligence, software development, and computer vision.

Kurt Andre P. Adodoli

Lead Programmer

Technological Institute of the Philippines

Frequently Asked Questions

How accurate is PesoScan?

Our model achieves over 99% accuracy in laboratory testing. However, accuracy may vary based on image quality, lighting conditions, and banknote condition. Always verify suspicious banknotes through official channels for important transactions.

What peso denominations are supported?

PesoScan currently supports all current Philippine peso denominations: 20, 50, 100, 200, 500, and 1000 banknotes. The system is trained on the latest polymer and enhanced security features.

Is my data stored or shared?

For the demo version, scan history is stored locally in your browser. In production, we follow strict privacy policies and do not share personal data. Images are processed temporarily and not permanently stored on our servers.

Can I use this for business purposes?

This is currently a research prototype for educational purposes. For commercial applications, please contact us for licensing and integration options with additional security and compliance features.

What should I do if I find a counterfeit banknote?

If PesoScan detects a potentially counterfeit banknote, do not pass it on. Contact your local bank, the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas (BSP), or law enforcement. Remember that this system is a detection aid, not a definitive authentication method.

Try PesoScan Now Back to Home
